intro: Puccinellia shuanghuensis, commonly known as the Shuanghu grass, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its small, spike-like inflorescences bear tiny flowers, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
